metadata.Title: CVE-2018-6051 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
XSS Auditor in Google Chrome prior to 64.0.3282.119, did not ensure the reporting URL was in the same origin as the page it was on, which allowed a remote attacker to obtain referrer details via a crafted HTML page.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-6051` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 64.0.3282.119-0ubuntu1
chromium-browser-l10n - 64.0.3282.119-0ubuntu1
chromium-chromedriver - 64.0.3282.119-0ubuntu1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 64.0.3282.119-0ubuntu1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 64.0.3282.119-0ubuntu1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '64.0.3282.119-0ubuntu1').
